item.title: Protozoa: Diagnostic Features and Classification Up to Class with Examples
item.description:
Protozoa: Diagnostic Features and Classification Up to Class with Examples

Introduction

Protozoa are single-celled eukaryotic organisms that are often microscopic and can be found in a variety of environments. They are classified in the kingdom Protista and are characterized by their diverse forms, structures, and modes of life. Protozoa play vital roles in ecosystems as both predators and prey, and they can also be pathogenic to humans and animals.

Diagnostic Features of Protozoa

  1. Cell Structure:
